Is this tested for both IPv4 and IPv6 ?
Done
Do you still need this section?
yes, there is a case where we may see flags populated as 0.
Ack. Anyway this will not harm anything being here.
When there are multiple IP addresses, i think we also need to handle IFA_F_SECONDARY here.
you mean multiple DHCP addresses from same server?
Multiple static IP addresses.

yes I have tested with multiple static addresses on the interface.
irrespective of  IFA_F_SECONDARY flag, origin of static addresses marked as "Static"
Ack
Can you please describe more, what is the issue which you are trying to fix it here?
Done

Hi Ratan/William 

Currently origin of ip address is populated based on DHCP enabled flag
so when DHCP is enabled then all static addresses are marked as DHCP
addresses and when DHCP is disabled all static addresses marked as
Static addresses.

This commit populates address origin based on ifa_flags from rtnetlink
message to fix this address origin issue.

I have updated commit message as well.
can you please review this commit?

Hi William/Ratan

can you please review this commit?
this commit fixes IP address origin issues

I have been doing some lengthy IPMI and RF tests on this commit. So far it improves aspects of the IPv6 address reporting.

It does seem to potentially break a contract to BMCWeb. I notice that BMCWeb now always reports DHCPv4: false, and OperatingMode: "Disabled".

Another possible side effect is that using RF to put the OperatingMode = Stateful does not enable DHCPv6Client. It only appears to modify IPv6AcceptRA.
Thank you, Johnathan for evaluating this commit. Probably https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/53959 is the bmcweb commit which you need along with this change

William/Ratan

can you please review this commit?
I'd like to see this commit move forward.
Thank you

William/Ratan

can you please review this commit?
Done
Done
Can you describe all the test cases which has been tested?

I have tested below mentioned configurations and checked origin of different types of IP addresses.

1. IPv4 and IPv6 static address configuration 
2. DHCPv4 and DHPCv6 enable/disable
3. Linklocal and SLAAC address configuration.

I noticed all these different address has got valid address origin populated with this commit
Do we still need this condition? if Yes why?

Yes, does not need this condition anymore.
will remove
Done
We can optimise if and if..else condition by checking common conditions "info.scope == RT_SCOPE_UNIVERSE" only once in top and "info.flags & IFA_F_NOPREFIXROUTE" only once for if..else conditions.
sure will check if we can optimise these check
RT_SCOPE_LINK can be static, otherwise link local addresses assigned static

I see RT_SCOPE_LINK set to link local ip addresses only.
even in our existing code currently we decide link local address based on RT_SCOPE_LINK flag.
for static addresses IFA_F_PERMANENT along with RT_SCOPE_UNIVERSE
Looks Good to me, Let's wait for few days to william to take a look on this.

William 
can you please review this commit?

Hi Ratan

can you please merge this commit
I second Ravi's request for this to be merged.

I don't think you can accurately determine the type of address based on the flags from the kernel. It would be better to query systemd-networkd directly even though it would involve a DBus call to do so.

I have tested this patch thoroughly, I could see origin value determined accurately 
for different of IPs
This is incorrect, both DHCP and SLAAC can have MANAGETEMPADDR
it also check  IFA_F_NOPREFIXROUTE along with MANAGETEMPADDR which make sure its SLACC IP address.
